item.title: ~/.ssh/config and you
item.description: What is exactly ~/.ssh/config? It’s the place for the user-specific configuration for ssh. Like almost any-other CLI tool, ssh accepts a set of configuration parameters by flags, a global config file, or a user config file. What is it useful for? You can configure a lot of parameters for your connections. If you usually connect to one or more hosts via SSH, it makes things like selecting the identity key, or using a different host alias a breeze.
